title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating the cultural landscape is reflected in building or architecture of the Great Mosque.

Two points for describing how the cultural landscape is connected to the Great Mosque by using specific features of Image 1.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the location shown in Image 1 in terms of a cultural landscape using one of the following:
The response correctly describes the location shown in Image 1 in terms of a cultural landscape using one of the following:
The response correctly describes the location shown in Image 1 in terms of a cultural landscape using one of the following:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that ethnic religions are primarily localized or within a certain region.

Two points for explaining the process of how followers of an ethnic religion are distributed.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the global population distribution of the followers of an ethnic religion relates to the religion’s place of origin:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the global population distribution of the followers of an ethnic religion relates to the religion’s place of origin:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the global population distribution of the followers of an ethnic religion relates to the religion’s place of origin:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that there are multiple religions present.

Two points for explaining how and why Jerusalem attracts followers of religions other than Judaism.
descriptions: The response does not correctly use the location shown in Image 2 to explain one of the following ways that a single pilgrimage site can attract peoples from different belief systems:
The response correctly uses the location shown in Image 2 to explain one of the following ways that a single pilgrimage site can attract peoples from different belief systems:
The response correctly uses the location shown in Image 2 to explain one of the following ways that a single pilgrimage site can attract peoples from different belief systems:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that relocation diffusion moves from one location to another while maintaining cultural traits.

Two points for explaining how relocation diffusion is connected to international travel to pilgrimage locations.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that relocation diffusion can account for the spatial patterns of international travel to pilgrimage locations:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that relocation diffusion can account for the spatial patterns of international travel to pilgrimage locations:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that relocation diffusion can account for the spatial patterns of international travel to pilgrimage locations:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that different ethnic groups can compete for political control over pilgrimage sites.

Two points for explaining how conflict occurs between ethnic groups over pilgrimage sites.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that ethnic nationalism may result in conflicts over the political control of pilgrimage locations:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that ethnic nationalism may result in conflicts over the political control of pilgrimage locations:
